intro: Dichanthelium conjugens, commonly known as the narrowleaf beakgrass, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with two bracts at the base of each flower. It typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Dichanthelium conjugens is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
